Dear Phil:
The more I think of a John Weiss Fund# the more I think it would re¬
quire clearance with Ford, or the Fund for the Advancement# and his
widow. Their questions would be legitimate:
- Why should the NAEB (instead of Ford or someone else)
pre-empt his name# or capitalize on it?
- What use would we make of funds contributed in his
name? (If funds were used for scholarships etc. there
would be no problem • But we need to have such funds
available as needed — with no limitations on use.
Nearly everything else we now have is specifically
earmarked. That's our weakness at present.)
- The gift (which we hope will become an annual indus¬
trial associate contribution) could be given by you “in
memory*® or honor of John Weiss — of course# and
announced as such.
These are my own thoughts only. 1*21 feel out the Board still. By
May 11 (the date of our meeting) we*11 be able to say — but I®d be
surprised if the Board felt much differently.
We are definitely announcing that you will be making a surprise
presentation (to President Burton Paulu) at the noon luncheon on be¬
half of Motorola* If this isn*t okay# let us know post-haste# for
